Also a lot of mercs and BMWs on sale cause many buy using dealer full loans and then when the maintenance starts hitting or they get through a few months of ownership they realize that they haven't made the right decision because they over extended themselves and at that point they barely have any equity in the car so it goes back to the same dealer or sell at inflated price to be able to pay off remaining loan
It's all about how the car has been used and maintained
Wait can sell back to same dealership?
But if you zero down the loan will be way higher than market price sia
Since they internally finance the car
You can go back and ask them to take it since you're likely to default on payments
And to them it's free money unless you've absolutely thrashed the car because you've used it for a few months and paid them a fair amount
And they can still sell at roughly the same price as before because the price offered to you was highly inflated for the full loan
So 0 down is take from dealership the loan?

Then with high intreast   double combo to rob your wallet
Or they overinflate loan value outside to the creditor but you still end up with a similar situation
Just that in this case the dealership can buy back from you at a lower price and make you suffer more because if you default it's not their issue but between you and the lender
